thread.title: Oneida Nation reacts to Jeb Bush's comments on 'Redskins' name
thread.title_full: Oneida Nation reacts to Jeb Bush's comments on 'Redskins' name

title: Oneida Nation reacts to Jeb Bush's comments on 'Redskins' name
text:
Republican presidential candidate, former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush has made the Washington NFL team name part of his presidential campaign. (Photo: Jim Cole, AP)
27 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Like father, like son.
Jeb Bush has made the Washington NFL team name part of his presidential campaign. “I don’t think we need to be so politically correct and try to, through government, take the name Redskins off,” he said in New Hampshire this week, while noting he believes the real pejorative term is “Washington.”
The Oneida Nation of Central New York called such talk disappointing, “but sadly not surprising.”
George H.W. Bush wore an Atlanta Braves jacket at a campaign stop 23 years ago this month while performing the tomahawk chop, saying, “This is what I’m going to do to Governor Clinton.”
The Oneida Nation of Wisconsin said in a statement at the time that Bush “just narrowed the choice for president in Indian country.”
The more things change, the more they stay the same.
FOR THE WIN
Jeb Bush suggests Washington Redskins change name to ... Northern Virginia Redskins
TOP VIDEOS
